description: From Middle English untamed, untemed, equivalent to un- +‎ tamed and/or untame +‎ -ed. Compare Dutch ongetemd (“untamed”), German ungezähmt (“untamed”), Danish utæmmet (“untamed”), Swedish otämd (“untamed”), Icelandic ótamin (“untamed”).

adjectives.description: untamed (comparative more untamed, superlative most untamed)

entries.meaning: Wild, uncontrolled, especially of animals not domesticated or trained to human contact.
examples: The mustang is an untamed horse that roams where it wants, with little interest in humans.
